alert.note: Alert for Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 07 at 3:20AM EDT until October 08 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Coastal DownEast, Interior DownEast, and Penobscot Valley Maine, including the following areas, in Coastal DownEast Maine, Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington. In Interior DownEast Maine, Central Washington and Interior Hancock. In Penobscot Valley Maine, Southern Penobscot. * WHEN...From this afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may clog with fallen leaves. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Locally heavy rainfall will begin by mid to late afternoon, continuing through tonight before tapering off around sunrise Sunday morning. Around 1.5 to 4 inches of rain are expected, with locally up to around 5 inches of rain possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
